publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3645 Bill Kidd: Workfare and Labour Privatisation—That the Parliament notes with concern reports that private contractors only placed 6% of the Incapacity Benefit claimants on their books into work by October 2008 compared to 14% by public service Jobcentres over the same period and calls on the UK Labour Government to abandon its workfare policy and its moves to further privatise Jobcentre services.
S3M-3645 Workfare and Labour Privatisation (lodged on 9 March 2009) Rob Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Brian Adam*, Sandra White*, Bob Doris*, Bill Wilson*
S3M-3645 Workfare and Labour Privatisation (lodged on 9 March 2009) Anne McLaughlin*

S3M-3645 Bill Kidd: Workfare and Labour Privatisation—That the Parliament notes with concern reports that private contractors placed only 6% of the Incapacity Benefit claimants on their books into work by October 2008 compared to 14% by public service Jobcentres over the same period and calls on the UK Labour government to abandon its workfare policy and its moves to further privatise Jobcentre services. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Aileen Campbell, Brian Adam, Sandra White, Bob Doris, Bill Wilson, Anne McLaughlin, Michael Matheson*, Dave Thompson*, Stuart McMillan*, Gil Paterson*, Christina McKelvie*
S3M-3645 Workfare and Labour Privatisation (lodged on 9 March 2009) Christine Grahame*
